content.description: Yet another fun moderate.  There are some neat chert globs up high on the route that look like holds that have been glued on the route.
content.location: This is the 6th route from the left.

climbs.name: unnamed
climbs.fa: Michelle Locatelli/ Richard and Lisa Harrison

content.description: Fun route up and out of small overhang in cliff. Crux move is just past the start of route, a reach move off slim pinch/sidepull to jug.
content.location: This is the second route down from the left side of crag.

content.description: Technical rock climbing leads to a jug, then more of the same to the anchors on bullet limestone.
content.location: Farthest route to the right, or 7th from the left.

content.description:
A tad bit sharp...Shares common start with Stay Foolish.  Starts 15 feet right of Yellow Pine and 10 feel left of "Unknown 2" (the far right 11A).  Follow the 2 shared bolts with Stay Foolish, clip the upward traversing bolt and head left toward the arete/corner (you can climb either the arete while liebacking the corner/crack or stemming in the corner) and up for 2 more bolts to the anchor.  

  I considered a straight up start through the blocky start, but this seemed like the more natural (and certainly the easier) line. It's easy to TR the direct start which is fun but quite hard and kind of loose as you come out of the starting corner and onto the face.
content.protection:
5 Stainless Bolts to a Double Stainless Fixe Super Shut Anchor 

This route was bolted solely for the purpose of allowing for the first ascent, and the first ascent information is posted here solely to document the history of the first ascent.  No person should read this posting with the assumption that this route or the fixed gear left behind is safe in any way or otherwise appropriate to allow for safe subsequent ascents.  Climbing is dangerous and should only be done with the appropriate training and risk management practices that include providing for the climbers own safety.  Attempting to climb this route as described above or by any other means or methods could result in injury or death.
content.location: 15 feet right of "Yellow Pine 5.10"; Shared start with "Stay Foolish"

content.description:
Follow first 2 bolts of Stay Hungry. Head right and up past 4 more bolts to shared anchor. 

  Fantastic, but bouldery, moves in the white rock.
content.protection:
6 Stainless Bolts to Double Stainless Fixe Super Shut Anchor

content.location: 15 Feet Right of "Yellow Pine 5.10";  Shared Start with Stay Hungry.

content.description: Nice climbing on blocky edges and jugs.  Thought provoking and will give a slight pump.  Good route to run laps on.
content.location: This route is located to the right of the route with red hangers; it is the 4th route from the left.

content.description: The first crux comes off the deck pulling on some good edges and making a big reach over a small roof to jugs.  The last crux is pulling the roof after the last bolt to gain the chains.
content.location: This is now the 3rd route from the left.  It is located just right of the steeper 11- route.  It is characterized by red hangers.  Needs some traffic as it has only two ascents as of 8/4/09.

climbs.name: Feed the Tree
climbs.fa: Michelle Locatelli/ Richard and Lisa Harrison

content.description: Tricky crux down low surmounting overhang, using small divots for holds. Another difficult move up high using thin holds. Do not use tree.
content.location: This is the far left route on the wall, starting from under the overhang.

content.description: Start five feet to the left of No Name. Climb up and left through a large break and past five bolts, arriving at the anchor of the steep unnamed 11-. Crux early. A little dirty right now, but cool, varied moves!
Another classic 5.10 route that is probably the best of the grade at Mt. Charleston - as if there are many 5.10's up there anyway.  Blocky edge climbing with a bit of a crux at the 4th bolt.
content.location: This is the 5th route from the left.

content.description:
This cliff is characterized by a cream-colored vertical main wall which contains 4 excellent moderate routes. It is flanked on the left by a shorter overhanging wall, and on the right by a route up a section of rough grey limestone. The is sunny until about noon, when it goes into shade. 

  Routes from left to right: 

Feed the Tree (5.11d) 

unnamed (5.11-) 

No Name (5.10b) 

The Punisher (5.10) 

1057 (5.10) 

Yellow Pine (5.10) 

unknown 2 (5.11-)
